intro: Antirhea acutata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed antirhea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
